LOADSCREENHINT.szName: This template should never show up
Most machineguns have replacable barrels. Use this to rapidly cool down your gun during combat.
Use your knife on a corpse to retrieve its uniform, or pick up the corpse.
Spies can use enemy uniforms to disguise as soldiers.
You can toggle between different scopes and sights by pressing [.].
Leaving food around for a few days will spoil it, making it unhealthy.
You can clean poisoning by taking an antidote, or the DOCTOR assignment.
If a 'M' appears on your gun, that means it is currently mounted onto something, resulting in better stability.
Don't forget to check out Jagged Alliance: Flashback on Kickstarter!
Doorway blocked? Press [X] when beside someone to swap places.
Need help? Help yourself by pressing [H] in strategic screen. And visit the helping bears at www.ja-galaxy-forum.com
Turn the wheel to your fortune. Increase Chance To Hit (CtH) in all fire modes with the [MOUSE-WHEEL]. [ALT]+[MOUSE-WHEEL] sets size of auto-fire volley.

Some sectors offer facilities like bars or mines that you can assign mercs to in strategical. Tool tips hinting at facility's function appear when assigning a merc just like you'd assign a merc to repairing, doctoring or training militia.

Guild of thieves. Steal opponent's gun with the hand-cursor [CTRL]+[LEFT-MOUSE-BUTTON]. If enemy is kissing the dust in a non-dying state you may strip off really everything carried including additional ammo and armour.
EOD flag signals. Mind you, the blue flag you may put in a tile on ground to mark a mine or trap you've spotted is also seen and reacted to by the enemy.
Colour your vision! Holding [END] in tactical screen shows currently selected merc's detailed field of vision, ranging from red (don't spot nobody) to green (spot even somebody lying in the grass).
Red Alert! Holding [DEL] in tactical screen shows where enemies you know of may see currently selected merc, ranging from red (will be seen even prone) to green (perfect concealment).
Jagged windowing. Shoot the glass (where necessary), face the open window and climb through it with [SHIFT]+[J].
While in sector inventory, click empty inventory slots for a list of items you may want to put there.
While in sector inventory, click empty attachment slots for a list of compatible attachments.
While in sector inventory, [CTRL] click empty inventory slots for a categorized list of items in that sector.
When choosing items via popup menus (accessible through clicking empty inventory / attachment slots), least damaged items are used.
Press [CTRL]+[SHIFT]+[X] to enable real-time sneaking. When active, you won't enter turn-based mode when you spot enemy soldiers - as long as they are not alerted of your presence.
Press [CTRL]+[X] to enter turn-based mode while real-time sneaking is active. Only works when you see enemy soldiers.
Illuminate night time enemies with flares to increase your chance of shooting them.
Your merc under fire and cant get back? Cover them with smoke grenades.
Depending on your settings, fully repairing a gun cleans it as well.
Shops not only sell, but also buy some of your gear. They are quite picky though.
Afraid enemy will interrupt you? Shoot their legs and hope they fall.
It is harder to hit a running enemy.
Open a useful sector menu with [CTRL]+[.]
Increase the number of bullets on automatic fire with [RIGHT-MOUSE-BUTTON].
Merge alcohol with rag to create a molotov cocktail.
Some NPCs can be bribed...
Sneaking while running seems unintuitive, but it works.
You can quickly kill a prone enemy with a knife.
If the enemy is alerted, they might call in reinforcements...
Bobby Ray's website will be available if you progress.
Sneaking near unalerted enemies trains your agility, but is risky.
Punching increases your dexterity and strength.
Doctoring and arming bombs will increase your wisdom.
Remote bombs can be detonated with a remote detonator - put it in your hands and press [RIGHT-MOUSE-BUTTON].
If you want to manually move items, you can use the MOVEITEM-assignment inside cities.
You can toggle firemodes with [B].
Pressing [SHIFT]+[R] in tactical screen orders your entire team to reload.
Press [S] to stand, [C] to crouch, [P] to go prone an [R] to stand and run.
Press [Z] to toggle sneak mode.
Throwing knives can instantly kill an enemy if he is unalerted.
You can open a useful description box by clicking [RIGHT-MOUSE-BUTTON] on an item.
Long-term mercenary contracts are cheaper. In the long term.
Not paying M.E.R.C. bills might have consequences...
If the enemy conquers your sectors, they might take your stuff.
Doctors can instantly restore some life lost via surgery - this will drain your medical supplies a lot.
Taking too many drugs has consequences.
If you'll ever get airborne, those SAM sites might come in handy.
At the start of the combat use [SHIFT]+[B] shortcut to drop all backpacks your mercs carry. At the end of combat use [CTRL]+[SHIFT]+[F] shortcut to pick them all back up.
You can destroy blue flags on mines by throwing grenades on them. Enemy may step on unflagged mine. Then again, you may as well.
Use [L] shortcut to face direction. Press [L] again to ready weapon and look through a scope if your gun has any scope or iron sights.
Always try to end turn with your mercs at least crouched. It protects you from unintentional friendly fire.
You can spray an area with auto fire. Just select auto fire, chose how many bullets you want to fire, press and hold [LEFT-MOUSE-BUTTON] on first target and drag it around the desired area.
Cambria has hospital where you can heal your mercs.
Bipods only give bonuses if you are lying prone or when gun is mounted.
Heavy weapons take a lot of energy if you fire or even hold them ready while standing. Go prone to save energy.
Whenever you can, always use cover.
Rebel militia can take away some enemy fire from your mercs. Don't count on them to do all the work though.

Mobile militia can follow mercs while travelling on map. It will follow merc group as long as you keep 1 sector close to them. Make sure you wait for them to arrive to your position before moving again.
In the militia redistribution menu, holding [CTRL] will move 5 militia. [SHIFT] will move all in a sector.
Mobile militia can help you when you attack a town if you keep them with you and call them as reinforcements before battle.
Sector inventory. On top of the screen you can see many buttons that help you sort and filter items. Hanging mouse over each button will show explanation for that button.
HP ammo does great damage but is easily stopped by body armor. AP ammo can penetrate body armor but does less damage.
Use HP ammo to kill bloodcats.
Helping locals will boost their loyalty. Talking to them may sometimes reveal some useful information as well.
You need to have enough loyalty in town before you can train militia there.
Mercs with teaching skill train militia faster.
Shortcut [O] opens up options menu in game.
Shortcut [ALT]+[S] will quicksave game in a quicksave slot. [ALT]+[L] will quickload game from quicksave slot.
Shortcut [CTRL]+[S] will open up save menu instantly.
In the main menu holding [ALT] while clicking 'Continue saved game' option will instantly load last saved game.
Yellow shirts are admin type of enemies that have worst equipment and weapons and get replaced by regulars not long after you arrive in Arulco.
Red shirts are Deidranna's regular army and will face you most of the game.
Black shirts are mercenaries hired by Deidranna. They have best equipment and weapons and are toughest of enemies. Higher difficulty levels increase their numbers.
Green militia can be trained further to become regular militia. Regular militia is more useful but costs more to train and maintain.
Veteran militia can't be trained. Militia can become veteran after combat if they performed well.
Try to bandage dying merc as soon as possible, or otherwise the merc may bleed to death.
Always try to give a sidearm to your snipers. Snipers are of limited use in close combat situations.
Stun grenades can help you render enemy helpless. You can steal equipment from helpless enemies.
Try to stun or suppress enemies before throwing tear gas grenade at them. That will prevent them from getting out of tear gas range.
Always check if enemy has gas mask before using tear gas on him. Hold [ALT] key while targeting enemy to see his details. Amount of details depend on the distance from selected merc.
Make sure you have your gun fully loaded at all times [ALT]+[R].
Don't forget to use cover.
If trees get in your LOS (line of sight), press [T] to clear things up. You can press the [DELETE] key to get a better feel for your surroundings.
L.B.E. stands for Load Bearing Equipment.
Switch between ground and rooftop targets with the [TAB] key.
Shoot from behind cover and know how many AP's it takes to get your butt back down again.
Pay attention to what your mercs hear, it can save you a whole lotta pain if you know where they're coming from!
You'll see a white "Ping" blink on the location of any overheard sounds.
Firing your weapon can draw some heat away from an injured merc or someone who's in it knee deep!
Stay away from light sources at night and try to use them to your advantage.
Press [ALT]+[Z] to order all your mercs to stealth mode, and [=] to select them all.
Relying on sound is even more important at night, you'll hear more than you can see without the proper equipment.
Night Ops are probably your best bet early on, if you are relying on pistols and S.M.G.'s.
Press [G] to toggle on/off the light around your merc.
If you get caught in a thunder storm, be on your toes, a flash of lightning can give away your position and the rain makes it harder to see.
Don't stay bunched together either, a stray bullet or grenade can do serious damage to your whole squad.
Every move you make, determines how the battle unfolds.
Always deal with the present threat before carrying out a plan.
When moving on a roof top, try to move in straight lines, moving diagonally can slow you down.
Marbles can be surprisingly useful in a fist fight.
If you need to get somewhere fast, make sure you don't exceed 100 percent weight on your mercs. It will slow the squad down.
Counting bullets during a fight is tough. Don't be surprised when your mercs forget how many they have left.
Each mercenary have different approach effectiveness when talking to an NPC. Different backgrounds may have an effect on them too. Don't expect Biff to be effective at threatening people.
Each mercenary have different needs for sleep ranging from 3 to 12 hours to fully regenerate energy. "Night Ops" trait allows to reduce this time even further.
Each mercenary have different tolerance for number of deaths in your squad and your overall reputation in Arulco.
If you have two people in team that don't like each other, avoid keeping them in the same sector for more than an hour.
Certain merceries can not gain stats at all. You canâ€™t teach an old dog new tricks.
Game manuals, hotkey list, map editor tutorial and more useful documents can be found in the "Docs" folder in your JA2 installation directory.
Game manuals, hotkey list, map editor tutorial and more useful documents can be found in the "Docs" folder in your JA2 installation directory.
Do you want to fight against real players or do co-operate teamwork together with your friends? Try out the 1.13 multiplayer mode.
Press [CTRL]+[SHIFT]+[G] to toggle mercenary formation move. When ON and you select more then one merc, they will keep their current formation.
Press [CTRL]+[SHIFT]+[S] to sell all items in your current sector inventory at once.
[CTRL]+[SHIFT]+[E] will load your vehicle with as much items as possible from your current sector. [SHIFT]+[E] will unload all items from vehicle to your current sector.
If you can't hit a target from your current location, you can try to suppress it with auto fire and then change to a better position.
Exploring the farms and city sectors can help you find lots of useful items, like gas for your vehicle.
In tactical screen, pressing and holding [RIGHT-MOUSE-BUTTON] over your merc will open up merc's menu similar to the one you have on strategic screen map.
